posts.author: Azshanola
posts.content:
Hello! I am fairly new to the game,(only about a month or so total) and building in general. I have to say the hardest part about it is not knowing what I want to do it's the intimidation I feel about making new characters, feeling like I lack the knowledge of skills and their caps and feats in particular. Regardless! I come to you to ask with help for a cleric. I want to make this character for PVP and as the title says it's for Arelith so that means the usual. Level 30 cap, have to take 3 levels in a class before you can leave it, as I said I'm new and that includes to Arelith so correct me if I'm wrong but I think the best I can get are things like AB+3, damage bonus slashing +6, plus, and another 4 divine damage if I can get the right essence(as far as weapons anyways, its low magic). RDD, shifter and PM are all out of the question. It's also a fairly slow leveling server so something that could survive well during the time it takes to get up there would be nice. Oh! Dev critical is disabled as well.

Here are specific spell changes: http://arelith.com/ph_magic.html

But some specific changes are no stacking weapon buffs, all of bigby's have a reflex save. Epic spell focus provides a special custom spell for each school. The specific spells are list above one or two sections down.

As far as getting down to the meat of things! I'd like to do elf. There are a couple of subraces on Arelith that change the racial stat weights, the only one I was interested in for RP besides just "elf" is sun elf. Sun elf: Int+2, con-2/Favoured class: Wizard

As I said in the title I'm interested in cleric, what I'd like to do with the build is make it a bit heavier on melee. I don't have a particular preference for one hand with shield or two hander but I would like to use a longsword(It's Corellon's favoured weapon, the god the character will be following). So essentially I was hoping a sort of battlecleric I suppose, that's what I had in my mind anyways. As far as spells I'd assume for that some that are offensive but primarily to buff myself up. Obviously abjuration perhaps being useful with the +2 to dispel checks per focus and +6 with epic focus, just so that I don't make myself powerful and ready to go then lose all momentum when the buffs are gone.

Aside from all of that! Feel free to suggest what you see fit! I'm new to building and I'd love to see the logic behind your answers and going deep into them to give good examples of skill caps, what I want where, etc. Thank you in advance!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hail and welcome to the ECB, Azshanola!

I have been a member for a while and I have to tell you, I like your attitude! You could check out the Game Guides section to start understanding what NWN character building is all about. I myself have written a guide on the Cleric class, which you can use as reference both to build and to play, and a complete guide to the logic of building. There is a lot of information there, as you have probably figured, but alas, it's a very complex game. I also provide links to several builds in the main post to serve as reference.

As for this particular build, I'm thinking Cleric / Champion of Torm / X (probably Rogue). This way you can have lots of feats and high saves. Maybe Cleric 17 Rogue 3 CoT 10 with Cleric 17 CoT 3 pre-epic for a BAB of 15 (a good thing if you are a Cleric). If you want to be indispellable, you need 24 Cleric levels, so that restricts the combo possibilities a lot. If you want to avoid being vulnerable even while being dispellable, you can just have multiple copies of the important buffs and just rebuff if dispelled. Besides, there is always Mordenkainen's Disjunction, which will stripe you of your protections regardless of Caster level. Another possibility is Cleric 16 (you'll lose lvl 9 spells) CoT 10 Rogue 4, which would allow you a much smoother leveling thanks to UMD and Tumble updates in pre-epic. Start with Cleric 15 Rogue 3 CoT 2 pre-epic, and go CoT 8 Cleric 1 Rogue 1 in epics. You'll probably need to take 15 Cleric in a row, then 3 Rogue and then 3 CoT. The last Cleric level could come at 30 and the last Rogue at 27, the rest being CoT.

So, before I even attempt to build you something, which one is it? Dispellable and more versatile or indispellable and limited?

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Azshanola wrote:I had some additional questions on the build after looking at everything, I noticed there isn't any discipline and as a melee character won't that be a major problem? I figure getting knocked down will be the end of me. The second question is why points into spot? With true seeing isn't it not an issue?

Also what spells are going to be used to buff the character?
Well, feel free to tweak Discipline into the build if where you play there aren't any immunities to KD. You can get rid of Spot. This was more of a second-nature thing, since I didn't really take my time with this build, I made it in about 5 minutes. Where I play, immunity to KD is fairly common at the cost of some AC, and True Seeing was changed to add to Spot, so I subconsciously took that into consideration when crafting this build, at least now you know why. However, Discipline is only a class skill for CoT, so the first 18 levels you will HAVE TO do without it, from then on you can update it constantly. Please know that we won't learn a server's rules unless we are going to play there ourselves, so ultimately, server-specific tweaking is up to none other than you. I didn't even read the spell changes and I doubt anyone here will when we build you something, we have lives LOL. There might be something in there that weakens or strengthens this build, I wouldn't know, that's where you come in, right?

About the buffs, read my Cleric guide, man, it's all in there! But as a rough guide:

Long-term: Bull's Strength (Empowered to have a higher result)
Cat's Grace (to give you 1 AC from dex bonus to go with full plate)
Extended Bless
Extended Shield of Faith
Extended Aid
Darkfire
GMW (you gotta pick between Darkfire and GMW in Arelith apparently, so pick one)
Magic Vestment (x2, one for armor and one for shield)
Mage Armor (+1 Dodge AC and +1 Natural AC without items)
Owl's Wisdom (Empowered for more effectiveness)
Endurance (Empowered for more HP)
Extended Freedom
Death Ward
Extended Negative Energy Protection
Extended Spell Resistance
Extended True Seeing

Short-Term:
Divine Favor (all lvl 1 spells)
Extended Divine Favor (all lvl 2 spells except for Extended Bless and Extended Shield of Faith)
Extended Divine Power (as many slots as you have except for Freedom)
Extended Prayer (a couple)
Extended Battletide (a couple)
Extended Aura of Vitality (a couple)
Extended Regeneration (a couple)

Basically, you buff up with your long term buffs (you can have multiple copies of the most important ones to deal with dispels) as soon as you wake up, then before every battle (every battle that requires buffs, obviously) you buff with Divine Favor and Extended Divine Power, and you have a couple of "full power modes" a day where you add one of each of the other buffs and use an Extended Divine Favor instead of a normal one (for tougher battles). Knowing how to conserve your buffs is VITAL to playing Clerics well, so don't buff up before EVERY ENCOUNTER or you'll run out all the time.

But, before you go playing this guy like a self-buffer from level 1, read my guide, OK?

Take it EZ!
